language.name: English (UK)
language.author: Fiona
language.phrases: Select the parameters you want to search the logs with.
Delete logs older than this many days
View logs of actions performed in the admin area that are unrevertable.
No logs found that match this criteria.
Search logs from this many days
There was a error deleting these logs.
Please at least input a page name.
There was an error adding one of the required phrases.
There was an error selecting this help document.
This is the directory that attachments that users upload are placed in. It is relative to the message board root, and must have the trailing slash. It must also have writing permissions.

If this is disabled avatars will be turned off across the entire forum.

When on, this value can be changed for individual user groups by editing the relevant permission.

If this is disabled avatars, all users will not be able to chose an off-site image for their avatar.

When on, this value can be changed for individual user groups by editing the relevant permission.

If this is disabled avatars, all users will not be able to use the forums avatar gallery.

When on, this value can be changed for individual user groups by editing the relevant permission.

If this is disabled avatars, all users will not be able to upload avatar images from their computers.

When on, this value can be changed for individual user groups by editing the relevant permission.
This is the directory that avatars that admins upload are placed in. It is relative to the message board root, and must have the trailing slash. It must also have writing permissions.
This name will be placed in various parts of the message board. For instance, the title bar and e-mails your users recieve from the board.

This needs to be the complete URL where your board is located, without trailing slash. ' / '

For instance, these would be correct URLs:
http://www.mysite.com
http://www.mysite.com/forum

This would be an incorrect URL:
http://www.mysite.com/forum/

This is a small bit of text that is placed at the bottom of the page, it is designed to place a copyright message.
Note that the FSBoard copyright message will still appear alongside your own.

You can elect to show debugging information at the footer of ever page. Everyone can see this, so be mind ful of exposing the inner workings of the message board.

Level 1
This will show how long the page took to generate on the server in miliseconds, and will also say how many queries were made to the database in that time.

Level 2
This level will show Level 1 and in addition will show extensive information about all the queries that were made to the database. It is not recommended that you turn this on unless it is for troubleshooting problems.
You should turn this on if the current timezone selected is in daylight savings time. Note that logged in users can set their own DST setting.
This is the directory that emoticons that admins upload are placed in. It is relative to the message board root, and must have the trailing slash. It must also have writing permissions.

Enter here the format you wish all dates on the message board to be displayed as, this uses the format employed by the PHP date() function.

Examples:
F j, Y : March 16, 2007
D M j : Fri Mar 16
l, jS \o\f F Y : Sunday, 16th of March, 2007

Enter here the format you wish all times on the message board to be displayed as, this uses the format employed by the PHP date() function.

Examples:
g:i a : 7:10 pm
H:i:s : 19:10:35
This is the address to your homepage. Used with Homepage Name to create a link to your site on every message board page.
The title of your website. Used with Homepage URL to link to your site on every page.

When someone is logged in, the message board keeps a record of their session. If you turn this on then they message board will ensure that they are still using the same web browser
This is to tackle a method of hacking known as "cookie hi-jacking" and it recommended that you turn this on if you require such high security.

When someone is logged in, the message board keeps a record of their session. If you turn this on then they message board will ensure that they are at the same IP address.
This is to tackle a method of hacking known as "cookie hi-jacking" and it is very recommended that you turn this on.
When an e-mail is sent from the message board, the return e-mail will be set to this.

Most of the time you will be able to use the mail directives set in PHP. If however you have your e-mail serevr that you would like to use, then select "SMTP Server" here and input the information below.
If you have selected the SMTP method for mail sending, you need to select the address here. This must be a domain name or an IP address. If the server is on the server, then input "localhost".
You may need to specify a password for authentication for an SMTP server. Input it here if you require it.
Most of the time SMTP servers use port 25. If your server uses a different port, then input it here.
You may need to specify a username for authentication for an SMTP server. Input it here if you require it.
When maintenance mode is on, users that do not have the correct permissions to view the message board will be greeted will this message.
You can turn off your message board by turning on the maintenance mode here. All users will be unable to use the message board, apart from administrators who can still view the message board.
This is the directory that post icons that admins upload are placed in. It is relative to the message board root, and must have the trailing slash. It must also have writing permissions.
If you wish to stop people registering a new account on your message board enable this setting. Users will be told that you're no longer accetping registrations.

When this is on, the message board will make sure that the e-mail address a user signs up with does not already exist. This ensures that all users will have their own e-mail address. This is one method of tackling spam bots.
If you would like to be notified by e-mail when someone registers an account, then turn this on. This uses the address placed in the "Outgoing e-mail address" setting.

Here you can select the process a user must go through before their account is valid for use.

All accounts automatically validated
With this setting users will not have to validate their account. While this may seem easier on your users, note that it may make your message board a prime target for spam bots.

User E-mail Validation
When a user registers they will be sent an e-mail that contains a link to activate their account. This ensures that the e-mail is valid and that the user is not an automated machine.

Must be Moderator/Admin Approved
With this mode, the user account must be viewed by an administrator or a moderator and they need to decide if the account should be accepted or not. This requires there to be an admin or moderator monitoring the board for new members periodically.
This will show a short rules summary when someone registers a new account. This serves to quickly alert them of the message board rules before they continue.
This is the rules that is shown to the user when they register. "Show rules when registering" must be turned on for this to show up.
This is the title that appears in the header of the registration rules.

If a user has not been active on the message board for this many minutes, then their forum session will expire. After this time they will not show up in the "Who's Online" sections of the message board.

The message board periodically updates a users last active time. This is the interval in minutes when the message board will update this value per user.
If you are getting a lot of traffic on your message board, increasing this value is one way in which you can reduce the server load.

On this page you will be shown the configuration values for the category you have selected.
Just make your changes and hit "Save Changes".

If you make a big mistake and you wish to revert the value back to when the message board was first installed. Hit "Reset" next to the value you want to revert.

This is the timezone that you wish the message board to default at. It's best to set this to the timezone that most of your visitors are in. Logged in members are able to change the timezone for their account.
This is the directory that avatars that users upload are placed in. It is relative to the message board root, and must have the trailing slash. It must also have writing permissions.
Specify a filename to export the settings as, this should end in .xml for correct import.
Select an XML file from your computer to upload and import settings from.

Specify a file path that relative is to your message board root, for instance, if your file is in the includes directory you would input:
includes/fsboard-settings.xml

You can export all of your message board settings as an XML file here.
If you have an XML file of settings to import then you can do this by either uploading the file to the server and specifying the filename, or by uploading from your computer using the form.
Doing this is useful if you are moving servers or want to backup your settings.

Note that files that were created from an older version of FSBoard will not be imported.

Here you can select which category of options you wish to change. Just select the category name and press "Go", the values contained in the selected category will be shown and you will be able to edit them.

This area contains all the configuration values for your message board.
All configuration values are organised into specific categories. To edit a value just select the category that it is contained in.

It is also possible to export all your configuration settings as an XML file for backup or to transfer the values to another installation.
If you turn this off a users post count will not increase if they make topics or posts in this forum.

This allows users to use BBCode in posts in this forum.
Users will only be able to use BBCode if this is set to yes and that the correct permission flag is set in their user group for it.

This will easily stop anyone posting on the forum regardless of their permissions flags if it is turned on.
People will still be able to view it if they're allowed.
This is a longer description of the forum. It's shown on the main forum view.

With this turned on users will be able to use emoticons in posts.
This will only take effect if the correct permission flag is set for their user group.

If you wish to quickly stop people accessing the forum without going through the tedious process of changing the permission flags, simply switch this to Yes.
No one will be able to view or post on the forum and it will not show up anywhere.

This allows users to use HTML tags in posts in this forum.
Users will only be able to use HTML if this is set to yes and that the correct permission flag is set in their user group for it.
Note: This is a potential security risk as users will be able to use Javascript and other crazy stuff. They'll also be able to break the formatting of the forum, it is not recommended you turn this on.
If this is set to yes, then the forum will become a category. Categories have no posts in and users are not allowed to post in them. They purely serve to group forums together.

This is the name of the forum, this should be descriptive as possible and yet not too long. It will appear on the forum listing, the breadcrumb, the title of the page and other places where it is appropriate.

With this turned on you can select a different theme that will only show on this forum. It will override the users selected theme in their profile.
Use the "Theme to use" to select the theme.
Use this to select the parent that this forum will be a child of. If you don't want it to act as a child-forum then keep the default "[ Forum Root ]".

You can lock users out of a particular forum unless they have the password to access it.
This is a quick way to only let a few people view a forum. Leave it blank if you don't want a forum to be password protected.

Tip
A better way to only let a few people view a forum would be making a new user group and only let that group access the forum. This is a very advanced topic however.

With this turned on users will be able to post polls attached to topics they create. Polls are multiple choice questionnaires that other users can vote on.
The correct permission flag must be turned on for their user group for this to take effect.
This is the order the forum will be seen in, relative to other forums. It's represented as a numerical value.

The quick reply form is a little form at the end of a topic view that will let people make replies without visiting the dedicated post page.
If you turn this off, the quick reply form will not appear in this forum.
Users can use quick reply form

If this is turned on the forum will not act as a real forum, instead it will forward to a separate URL.
The URL must be supplied using the "URL to redirect to" field.
Redirect this forum to another URL?
This will be the URL that the forum redirects to instead of acting as a forum to post in. You must make sure that "Redirect this forum to another URL?" is set to yes.
You can turn on a rules notification per-forum that appears at the top of every forum page. Just in case you want to ensure that users have no excuse knowing the rules.

The full text of the forum rules, these will only show up if you turn it on, and "Use global site rules" has not been selected.
This uses BBCode for formatting.
This is the header text for the rules. It defaults "Forum Rules" if this isn't defined.

The forum jump is a little drop down at the bottom of most pages letting people quickly go to a forum view without having to navigate to it manually.
If this is turned off, the forum will no longer appear on the forum jump.
This setting applies to all children the forum may have.

If "Override selected users theme?" is switched to yes, use this to select the theme to override the users when their view this forum.
If you wish to just override their selection with the default theme select "[ Use Default Theme ]".
If you turn on forum rules, this will use in the registration page rules instead of what you specify.

From here you can create a new forum.
The amount of settings can be overwhelming at first, but don't be alarmed! Most of them can be left, this help document will provide full information about each field.
Can open and close topics that the user has created. Closed topics cannot be posted in unless the correct permission flag has been checked.
Allowed to remove posts that they have created.
Allowed to delete topics that they have started. All posts in the topic will be deleted along with it.
Allowed to edit the content of their own posts.
Allowed to edit the title of topics that they have created.
User can move topics that they have created to another location.
User is allowed to attach polls to topics they create.
The word filter will not apply for this user.
User is allowed to post replies to topics that have been closed.
Can post replies on closed topics?
Allowed to post new topics in this forum.
When a user edits a post, they are allowed to stop the "edited by" message appearing.
Can remove "edited by" notice on posts?
Allowed to reply to topics started by other users.
Can reply to other members topics?
Allowed to reply to their own topics.
If the forum will appear on the forum jump, and the main forum view. Also if the user can enter the forum to view the topic list.

Allowed to use BBCode in posts.
This will only take effect if the appropriate option has been checked on the forum settings.
User is allowed to use emoticons in their posts.

Allowed to use HTML in posts.
This will only take effect if the appropriate option has been checked on the forum settings.
Note:
This is a potential security risk as users will be able to use Javascript and other crazy stuff. They'll also be able to break the formatting of the forum, it is not recommended you turn this on.
If the user can search this forums topics and posts.
Can see other users topics. Own topics can be viewed normally.
Can see and view other members topics?
User is allowed to vote on polls.

From here you can edit the permissions for the forum on a per-forum, per-user basis.

All user groups have a set of global forum permissions editable from the user group page, usually this is enough. However, sometimes you may want to edit the permissions of a group for an individual forum.
This is done from here. These permissions will override the default ones.
From here you can edit all the settings of an existing forum.

Here you will see a list of all the forums on your message board, they are shown in a graphical tree system so you can see children and parent relationships easily.

In the Actions column there is a dropdown box for every forum, the options are as follows:

Edit Forum
This will show a form for editing all the details of the selected forum. View the help documentation for that page for more information.

Add Child Forum
This is similar to the Add New Forum button, except that the parent field will already be filled out for convenience.

View Forum
This will send you to the forum on your message board so you can quickly go to it.

Delete Forum
This will delete the forum, all the child-forums it has and all the posts that were made in it. You will be asked to confirm your decision if you click this by accident.

The Permissions column lets you set permission flags for that forum per-user group. This is an advanced topic and more information about per-group per-forum permissions can be found on the help docs for that page.

To change the order that your forums are shown in, you need to change the "Order" field for the forum. This is a numerical field, the higher the number the further down the list the forum will be.
If you edit the order number be sure to cluck "Update Forum Positions" or they will not update correctly.

The "Add New Forum" button will send you to a page that will let you add a new forum to the message board.

Your message board needs to made up of one or more forums. Users will post topics and posts into forums. This is to serve as a sorting mechanism for different topics, after all, a list of topics about anything can be confusing!

In FSBoard, forums can be carefully categorised by giving them a particular parent, this creates a nested system of forums (This is represented as an easy to read tree in the forum manager.)

Forums can be grouped into a category if you wish, this will help to categorise your forums should you have a lot of them. Users cannot post in categories. To create a category add a new forum like you normally would but ensure that "Act as category" is ticked.
Are you sure you want to delete this help doc?
There are no help values saved.

This is the front page for your admin area. It includes some handy tools and information.

Quick User Moderation
To quickly edit a members status/username/posts etc. Search for their username in the input box. This will do a search for the username.

Admin Notes
Here you can save messages for yourself or other administrators for future reference.

Board and Server Information
These are a few pieces of information about the server FSBoard is currently running on.
Tip
If you have a problem you can't fix and decide to post on the message board at www.fsboard.com, then it is recommended you quote all the information here.


Daily Board Statistics
These are some quick daily board statistics, so you can see at a glance what happened on your message board the past 24 hours.

Change Admin Area Theme
If you don't like the current look of the administrator area, then you can easily change the theme here.

FSBoard Credits
A list of the folks that made FSBoard possible. Hello!

Welcome to your message board administration area! Here you can control almost every aspect of your message board.
Using the menu on the left you can navigate to various sections of the admin area and change parts of your message board.
The complexity of the admin area can be very daunting at first, however, clicking the help icon wherever it appears will give you all the information you need to know about that particular part.

Tip
A good place to start customising your message board would be configuration settings and forums.

E-mails are sent in batches to stop the server being overloaded all at once, or to prevent timeouts on the script.
You can set this to whatever you like, but between 50 and 100 is recommended.

Search through users e-mail addresses.

This does not need to be an exact match.

The URL a user selects as their homepage can be searched through here.

This does not need to be an exact match.
If users have chosen not to receive any e-mails, this will ignore that setting completely.

Use this to search the date that the member was last active on the message board, this will select everyone who was active after this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Last active date is before".

Use this to search the date that the member was last active on the message board, this will select everyone who was active before this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Last active date is after".

Use this to search the date that the member last posted on the message board, this will select everyone who posted after this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Last post date is before".

Use this to search the date that the member last posted on the message board, this will select everyone who posted before this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Last post date is after".

This is the message body that will be sent to the users.

The Following variables can be replaced with certain information based on the user and the board.

{board_name}: The name of the message board.
{board_url}: URL address of the message board root. Editable in the configuration page.
{user_id}: The ID number of the users account, this is not a name, it is the internal ID number. It can be used te send URLs to profiles for instance.
{user_joined}: Formatted date of when the user registered their account.
{user_email}: E-mail address of the user.
{user_num}: The amount of registered users on the message board.
{post_num}: The amount of posts that are on the message beard.
{user_name}: The name of the user, if you wish to personalise the message.
{user_posts}: The amount of posts that the user has on the message board.
{user_usergroup}: The primary user group of the user.
This is the address from which the e-mail will appear to be sent from.
This is the subject line, or title, of the e-mail that will be sent.
This will select all users with post counts higher than what you specify here. It can be used in conjunction with the "Post count is less than" setting.
This will select all users with post counts less than what you specify here. It can be used in conjunction with the "Post count is greater than" setting.

Use this to search the member registration date, this will select everyone who registered after this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Register date is before".

Use this to search the member registration date, this will select everyone who registered before this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Register date is after".

Search through users post signatures.

This does not need to be an exact match.

Using this form you send e-mails to some or all of your users based on extensive criteria.

When you input all the information and search criteria, hit "Preview". This will let you know how many users you have matched and show you a quick preview of the e-mail you want to send out.

You don't have to fill out all the entries. If you just want to search users by e-mail for instance, just fill that out that entry.
Leaving all entries empty will select all user accounts.

Search through the text in custom user titles.

This does not need to be an exact match.
If you wish to search through any secondary groups, you can select any amount of them here.
Search by primary user groups. Secondary user groups are not included with this.

Search by user name. You can select 4 different types of searches using the dropdown box.

Contains:
hell will match "hello", "ohhello" or "helloooo". But not "holp".

Is exactly:
hell will only match "hell". Not "ohhello", "helloooo" or "holp".

Starts with:
hell will match "hello" and "helloooo". But not "ohhello".

Ends with:
hell will match "hell" and "bloodyhell". But not "hello".

You can send e-mails to some or all of your users based on certain criteria.
E-mails are sent in batches in amounts that you define to prevent page time outs if too many e-mails are attempted to be sent.
Is allowed to close topics and open them again. Closed topics cannot be posted in.
Is allowed to delete any users posts.
Is allowed to delete any complete topics.
This will let the moderator edit anyone's forum posts.
Is allowed to edit the titles of topics.
Allowed to move topics to another forum.
Allowed to set topics as sticky. Sticky topics will always be placed at the top of topic listings in forums.
Allowed to see the IP addresses of users with their posts.
Here you can add a moderator to the selected forums. The permissions can be set for all these special actions.

Moderators let you add special privileges to users and user groups assigned to specific forums to help you manage a message board.

To add a moderator, select the forum(s) you wish to add a moderator to using the checkboxes and then select a user group or input a username.
The next screen will let you select the permission flags for this moderator and forum selection.

Search through e-mail addresses.

This does not need to be an exact match.
The name of the person who wrote the plugin. This is typically your name or a nickname.
Use this space to describe what the plugin does in more detail, for your own future reference, people who will be using the plugin and anyone who may want to alter it.
The name of your plugin, a good plugin name should be short but adequately describe what the plugin does.
This is the PHP code that will be run at the previously specified hook. It is not necessary to add PHP starting and closing tags. (<?php ?>)
The hook determines the time that a piece of code will run. The hooks are listed by page and a description of the hook, separated by a colon.
A sort piece of text to briefly describe what a hook does - for your benefit and others who may want to edit it later.
From here you can create a plugin file that will contain code to run. A file will be run at a certain time depending on the hook it is set to.
This is where you start creating a plugin. A plugin is just a container for multiple files that can run code at specified times.
You can edit the details and code of a specific plugin file hook from here.
From here you can edit the code contained within a plugin file. A file will be run at a certain time depending on the hook it is set to.
From here you can edit the details of an existing plugin.
Specify a filename to export the settings as, this should end in .xml for correct import.
Select an XML file from your computer to upload and import a plugin from.

Specify a file path that relative is to your message board root, for instance, if your file is in the includes directory you would input:
includes/fsboard-plugin.xml
Select the plugin you wish to export.

You can export a plugin as an XML file here.
Doing this is useful if you want to backup your plugins or wish to share it with other FSBoard owners.

If you have an XML file containing an FSBoard plugin then you can install it by either uploading the file to the server and specifying the filename, or by uploading from your computer using the form.
Note that files that were created from an older version of FSBoard will not be imported.

From here you can view a list of currently installed plugins. Selecting the edit button will allow you to edit the details of that plugin.

Selecting "View Files" will let you edit the segments of code used by this plugin.

There is a plugin system built into FSBoard allowing you, or others, to write code and safely plug it into the forum without having to change the existing underlying code.

This is a very advanced feature.

Plugins are split into multiple files that can be hooked into different areas of the forum.

It is also possible to export a plugin and all it's code as a single XML for distribution to others, or as a backup.
This page displays the files associated with the currently selected plugin.
A users e-mail address. Used to send e-mails to from the message board.
Password for the user that they will use to login.

From here you can generate a new user account that can be immediately logged into.
Once the new account is created, you will be forwarded to the edit user screen to fine-tune the account.
This is the group that the user account will belong to. Each user group has their own set of editable permissions in the Manage User Groups area.
The name that is displayed to the all other users and is used to login to the message board.

Search through users e-mail addresses.

This does not need to be an exact match.

The URL a user selects as their homepage can be searched through here.

This does not need to be an exact match.

Use this to search the date that the member was last active on the message board, this will select everyone who was active after this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Last active date is before".

Use this to search the date that the member was last active on the message board, this will select everyone who was active before this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Last active date is after".

Use this to search the date that the member last posted on the message board, this will select everyone who posted after this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Last post date is before".

Use this to search the date that the member last posted on the message board, this will select everyone who posted before this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Last post date is after".
This will select all users with post counts higher than what you specify here. It can be used in conjunction with the "Post count is less than" setting.
This will select all users with post counts less than what you specify here. It can be used in conjunction with the "Post count is greater than" setting.

Use this to search the member registration date, this will select everyone who registered after this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Register date is before".

Use this to search the member registration date, this will select everyone who registered before this date.

It must be supplied in the format DD-MM-YYYY, for instance March 16th 2007 would be 16-03-2007.

You can use this in conjunction with "Register date is after".

Search through users post signatures.

This does not need to be an exact match.

From here you can search through various extensive criteria to find the user accounts that you wish to view or edit.

You don't have to fill out all the entries. If you just want to search by e-mail for instance, just fill that one in.
Leaving all entries empty will search all user accounts.

Search through the text in custom user titles.

This does not need to be an exact match.
If you wish to search through any secondary groups, you can select any amount of them here.
Search by primary user groups. Secondary user groups are not included with this.

Search by user name. You can select 4 different types of searches using the dropdown box.

Contains:
hell will match "hello", "ohhello" or "helloooo". But not "holp".

Is exactly:
hell will only match "hell". Not "ohhello", "helloooo" or "holp".

Starts with:
hell will match "hello" and "helloooo". But not "ohhello".

Ends with:
hell will match "hell" and "bloodyhell". But not "hello".

Users are accounts that people use to visit your forum to post topics and messages.

Users are categorised into user groups, which serve to set basic permissions for those users. FSBoard comes with a default set of user groups, but you can edit them to your hearts desire if you so wish.

You can create a new user account quickly from within the admin area, as well as search for users based on an extensive criteria, and edit any information about that user.
No user will be able to upload a disabled file type, existing atachments and avatars of this file type will still exist.
There was an error inserting tihs extension into the database!
Do not add the . prefix for the extension
A file type with this extension already exists!
Path relative to board root to an icon representing the file type
In bytes, leave blank for no limit. This only applies to attachments.
In pixels, leave blank for no limit. Only applies to the following file types: .bmp .gif .png .jpg .tiff .swf .psd. This only applies to attachments.
In pixels, leave blank for no limit. Only applies to the following file types: .bmp .gif .png .jpg .tiff .swf .psd. This only applies to attachments.
Helps the browser decide what to do with a file. Leave this if you're unsure.
This will let users upload attachments of this file type.
This will let users upload avatars of this file type.

To make a quick-button appear on the input form, specify the image filename here. Path is relative to the current style image path.
Used on button pop-up and BBCode legend help window.
There was an error inserting this BBCode!
Example for use of this BBCode.
Appears on BBCode legend help window.

HTML to replace the BBCode with. Use {content} and {param}
For example, the BBCode [altimage=param] content [/altimage] would need something like <img src="{param}" alt="{content}">
Tag to use for this BBCode, inputting centre would require to use [centre] content [/centre] to use on the message board.
Please enter a tag and a replacement.
Makes this code require a parameter, for instance [tag=parameter] content [/tag] as opposed to [tag] content [/tag]
BBCode is the formatting system built into FSBoard and most other message board software. Here you can define your own BBCode that will be used in addition to what is already built-in.
Are you sure you wish to delete this BBCode? All uses of it on the message board will become unparsed.
There was an error editing this BBCode!

Attachments that users upload are placed here. Relative to message board root.

Disabling this will override group permissions.
Disabling this will override group permissions.
Disabling this will override group permissions.
In Kilobytes (Kb). Set to 0 to use user group permissions.
In pixels. Set to 0 to use user group permissions.
In pixels. Set to 0 to use user group permissions.
Disabling this will override group permissions.

Avatars uploaded through the admin area are placed here. Relative to message board root.
MUST BE WRITABLE (CHMOD 777)
The name of your message board that appears in various places.
Directory that your board is located, without trailing slash. ' / '
Turning this on will enable 'friendly URLs' across FSBoard.
Copyright message that appears at the bottom of every page.
Debug information to show at page footer. (Everyone can see this.)

If your time is out by an hour, it is probably due to daylight savings time.
Members can also change this in thier own settings.

Emoticons uploaded through the admin area are placed here. Relative to message board root.
MUST BE WRITABLE (CHMOD 777)
This is the format that dates will be shown as on the forum in PHP date() format
This is the format that times will be shown as on the forum in PHP date() format
The address your homepage link goes to.
The name of your website. Appears at the bottom of every page.
Check user browsers accross sessions? (Recommended if you want high security)
Check IP addresses accross sessions? (Recommended for security)
All e-mail sent appeas to come from here.
E-mails will be sent as HTML rather than plain text if enabled
PHP mail() is recommended. Use an SMTP server if this is unavailable.
SMTP login password. Usually not needed with 'localhost'.
SMTP login username. Usually not needed with 'localhost'.
Disable your board temporarily, administrators will still be able to view the board.
This message will be displayed to anyone who visits the board while maintenance mode is turned on.

Post icons uploaded through the admin area are placed here. Relative to message board root.
MUST BE WRITABLE (CHMOD 777)
Stop people from registering a new account?
Allow a user to sign up if an account with the same e-mail address exists?
Send the admin an e-mail when a user registers?
User accounts cannot be used until they are validated.
Show a short rules summary on the user registration form?
This short rules summary is shown when a user registers
Title of the table that rules are shown in
In minutes, user login sessions will not be retrieved if they're not active after this time.
In minutes, the last active time will only update in these intervals. Put higher for very busy boards.
Timezone offset. Members can change this on thier settings. Do not take daylight savings into account.

Avatars that users upload are placed here. Relative to message board root.
MUST BE WRITABLE (CHMOD 777)

You can configure various settings in your message board here.
The configuration is split into sections, select a section from this dropdown box and hit Go.
GMT -4 (Atlantic Time - Canada, Caracas, La Paz)
GMT -5 (Eastern Time - US, Canada, Bogota, Lima)
GMT -6 (Central Time - US, Canada, Mexico City)
GMT +8 (Beijing, Perth, Singapore, Hong Kong, Taipei)

Insignia are similar to user titles in that they are displayed next to a users posts. However they have a few fundamental difference; You may assign them to user groups, more than one of them may appear at once and you can define an image instead of just text.
For example, you could have insignia that display stars depending on how many posts a user has, or display a special image if a user is an administrator.
Languages are all the words and phrases shown on your message board that are generated by the script, you can edit them here.

You can change the theme used in the admin area here.

Welcome to your message board administration area!
Using the menu on the left you can navigate to various sections of the admin area and change parts of your message board.
A good place to start customising your board would be configuration settings and forums.

Hitting the help button wherever it appears will help answer any questions you have about that specific area.
Additional coding, some graphics and a barrel of support

Fired directly after showing the registration form.
• &\$entered_data: Array of data previously entered to the form. Keys: 'username', 'email', 'password', 'password2'
Fired directly before getting the template for the registration form.
• &\$entered_data: Array of data previously entered to the form. Keys: 'username', 'email', 'password', 'password2'
Fires directly before the plugin is set as installed - should be used to set up permanent settings, database tables and other data.
• \$plugin_info: Array of information about the plugin being installed direct from the database. Keys: 'id', 'name', 'author', 'description', 'installed', 'enabled', 'uniq_id'
Fires directly before the plugin is set as uninstalled - should be used to clean up any tables and data that were set when installed.
• \$plugin_info: Array of information about the plugin being uninstalled direct from the database. Keys: 'id', 'name', 'author', 'description', 'installed', 'enabled', 'uniq_id'

Users can bestow reputation points to each other and this is an indication of how popular (or unpopular) a person is. You can define the text that appears in a users profile depending on their reputation here.

You can export all of your message board avatars for import at a later time here, this is useful if you are moving servers, want to backup your avatars or wish to share them with another FSBoard user.
All image data is exported with the avatar information.

You can export all of your message board emoticons for import at a later time here, this is useful if you are moving servers, want to backup your emoticons or wish to share them with another FSBoard user.
All image data is exported with the emoticons information.

You can export all of your message board post icons for import at a later time here, this is useful if you are moving servers, want to backup your post icons or wish to share them with another FSBoard user.
All image data is exported with the post icon information.
Select the avatar category you wish to export, you can export categories individually or export them all as a whole.
Select the emoticon category you wish to export, you can export categories individually or export them all as a whole.
Select the post icon category you wish to export, you can export categories individually or export them all as a whole.
This is a file path that relative is to your message board root, for instance, if your file is in the includes directory you would put something like includes/fsboard-avatars.xml
This is a file path that relative is to your message board root, for instance, if your file is in the includes directory you would put something like includes/fsboard-emoticons.xml
This is a file path that relative is to your message board root, for instance, if your file is in the includes directory you would put something like includes/fsboard-post-icons.xml

Import a previously exported avatars file here, either upload a file to the server or use a file already uploaded. Note that files created from a later version of FSBoard will not be imported.
This will generate the image files and save them to <1>. This is editable in the configuration settings. It must exist and be writable.

Import a previously exported emoticons file here, either upload a file to the server or use a file already uploaded. Note that files created from a later version of FSBoard will not be imported.
This will generate the image files and save them to <1>. This is editable in the configuration settings. It must exist and be writable.

Import a previously exported post icons file here, either upload a file to the server or use a file already uploaded. Note that files created from a later version of FSBoard will not be imported.
This will generate the image files and save them to <1>. This is editable in the configuration settings. It must exist and be writable.
If set to yes, if the importer tries to save an image that already exists, it will replace it, if set to no it will ignore that avatar.
If set to yes, if the importer tries to save an image that already exists, it will replace it, if set to no it will ignore that emoticon.
If set to yes, if the importer tries to save an image that already exists, it will replace it, if set to no it will ignore that post icon.

Avatars are split into named categories, categories can be given per-user group permissions.
When you change the order be sure to submit your changes.

Emoticons are split into named categories.
When you change the order be sure to submit your changes.

Post icons are split into named categories, categories can be given per-user group permissions.
When you change the order be sure to submit your changes.

These define scripts which will be run at certain times. Note that they are run when someone visits your board, so the times should only be used as a guide.
Times are in GMT, current time is <1>.

Templates define how your message board appears, structure wise. Templates are structured into template sets, only one template set can be used on your board at one time. This area is for editing individual templates.
Template set has been deleted sucessfully!
Are you sure you want to delete this template set? All templates contained in it will be removed too. THIS IS NOT REVERSIBLE!
Cannot delete template set - It is currently the default.
Edit an individual template here. Once changes are made in the database, FSBoard will attempt to write to the template file.
User can choose their own theme if this is default
Edit some settings for this template set here.

You can export all of your message board templates and template sets for import at a later time here, this is useful if you are moving servers, want to backup your templates or wish to share your layouts with another FSBoard user.

Themes are CSS styles that define how your message board appears in terms of colour.
Themes can generally be used with any template sets.
Are you sure you wish to delete this theme?
There was an error removing this theme. Please try again.
There was an error switching user theme selection.
There was an error updating this theme.
Specify a filename to export the themes as, this should end in .xml for correct import.

Export themes here for import again a later time here, this is useful if you are moving servers, want to backup your themes or wish to share your designs with another FSBoard user.
Note that images are not exported.
Select the theme you wish to export, you can export individually or you can export all themes as a whole.
There was an error selecting these themes.

User titles are a tiny bit of text that can appear next to users posts, depending on how many posts they have. Individual users can override this with their own message.
There are no deleted items to be restored!
No items that were selected could be found.
The restoring process for the selected items was completed.

If something is accidentally deleted on your message board, you can attempt to restore them here. Deleted items will only stay here for up to 24 hours from their deletion date.

Note: Restoring data is not a clean process, other pieces of data and stats may not be restored correctly, only use this tool as a last resort.

User groups allow you to easily group forum members into groups. Each group has a set of permissions that you can edit to your own desire.
Default forum permissions are the read/write permissions that will be applied to all forums, you can edit these on a per-forum basis from the forum permissions page.
The groups that come installed with the forum cannot be deleteted.

Please enter a word and a replacement.
There was an error adding this word filter!
If off, setting 'sheep' as the word to replace will match 'sleep' and 'sleeping'. If on, it would only match 'sleep'.
A filter with this word already exists.
Are you sure you want to delete this word filter?
There was an error editing this word filter!
A word filter with the specified ID was not found.

A word filter can replace a word or phrase with another one. For instance, replacing swear words with ****.
The filter applies to all posts, topic titles, private messages, signatures etc.
The word filter will not be applied for a user if the relevant permission switch for thier user group is selected.

<username>, You have requested a password reset on <forum_name>.
------------------------------------------------- If you DID NOT request a password change then you should delete this message. -------------------------------------------------
To complete your password reset you must visit the link below:
<password_url>
(AOL users may need to copy-paste the link into your browser.)
If this does not work visit the following page:
<password_form_url>
And enter the following information by copy-pasting or typing it in:
User ID: <user_id> Validation Code: <validate_code>
Follow the instructions on the pages to reset your password.
-<forum_name> administrator.
-- This is an automated message. Please do not reply to it.

This account has not been activated. Please follow the instructions in an e-mail you should have recieved with signing up.
This account is currently not in the process of resetting it's password
